image.description: A wall with a crude drawing of a figure and text reading 'Nothing Ever Happens'

greentext: born with three arms and glowing eyes, but still wondering what it means to be human
search the wastelands for relics of the Old World and the Old Ones
scavenging ruins, trying to piece together what life used to be
find fragments of metal, plastic, and burnt books
text: everything is dust, ash, and memories of what once was
wander the endless deserts, shifting through the sand and rubble
out in the middle of the dead desert
no buildings, no shelters, just endless sand and sun
on a crumbling wall, half-buried in the dunes...a drawing ?
wide eyes, twisted mouth, staring into nothing
next to it, words in the old script language long lost to the bombs
Since that day I have always been perplexed by this drawing.Was this a warning? a lament?Or just madness scribbled on the edge of annihilation?

image.description: A stylized yellow face with a questioning expression

text: How do these people deal with being thirsty all the time?
